moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 d4 4. e3 Bb4+: The themed mini tournament started here.
moves.6. fxe3: Taking his bishop would have lost my queen.
moves.6... Bxd2+ 7. Qxd2 Qxd2+ 8. Kxd2: And boom! The queens are off and it's an endgame-like scenario since all the pieces are snoozing. I say it is very close to equal, as while white is up a pawn his king is displaced and he has two doubled, isolated pawns.
moves.8... Be6 9. Nf3 Nc6 10. Bd3 O-O-O 11. Nc: Both sides race to get their pieces out.
moves.11... Nb4 12. Ne1 Bf5 13. Nd5 Nxd3 14. N: I'd say black might have a thin edge as his rook is slashing down the d file very nicely.
moves.16. cxd5 Rxd5 17. Rac1: I grab a half open file, black has the edge for sure here.
moves.20. Rc3: White is desperately trying to defend as black swarms forward.
moves.20... Nc6 21. Re3 Nxe5: Black picks up a pawn and adds another attacker.
moves.22. b3 b5: He's going to chase away my rook.
moves.23. g3 Ng4: ? Better, much better would have been b4! It would have forced my rook to move.
moves.24. Rf3 Rxe4 25. Rxf7: As it is, white is let slightly off the hook. But black still has a big edge.
moves.25... Red4: ?? This is the move that threw it all away for black.
moves.26. Rcxc7+ Kb8 27. Rcb7+: Moving to c8 would allow checkmate, but I knew he wouldn't play that.
moves.27... Ka8 28. Rbxa7+: I am now up a pawn.
moves.28... Kb8 29. Rfb7+ Kc8 30. Rbc7+: I looked long and hard for a way to get mate, but I couldn't find one. I didn't want to continue to play being up a pawn, because he is still bearing down on my knight and king. So I forced a draw.
moves.30... Kb8 31. Rcb7+ Kc8 32. Rbc7+ Kb8 33: And I declared a draw. I felt it was a nice game, it was a good draw when I was behind.
